Authors:
Julia Checa, Walter M Jaklitsch, MarÃ­a N. Blanco, Gabriel
Moreno, Ibai Olariaga, Salvador Tello, Hermann Voglmayr
Title:
Two new species of Thyronectria from Mediterranean
Europe
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Cucurbitaria, Hypocreales, Nectriaceae,
phylogenetic analysis, Sordariomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
Two new species of Thyronectria growing in Mediterranean
vegetation are described from southern Spain; they are T. giennensis
from Quercus ilex ssp. rotundifolia and T. pistaciae from Pistacia
lentiscus. Both species are characterized by morphology of sexual and
asexual morphs and by DNA data. They have olivaceous to green-brown
muriform ascospores and are closely related to T. asturiensis and T.
roseovirens, as determined by multigene phylogenetic analyses of a
matrix containing six loci (ITS and 28S regions of nuc rDNA, ACT1, RPB1,
RPB2, TEF1 and TUB2 genes). We also report that Cucurbitaria bicolor is
a synonym of Thyronectria rhodochlora, the type species of
Thyronectria.

Thyronectria ITS, nuc 28S rDNA, ACT, RPB1, RPB2, TEF1,
TUB
